title: SOIL: BITs
description: 人々は、分散型アイデンティティについて学んだり、暗号エコシステム全般に関わったりするモチベーションがありません。

f6_assessments.q0: Proposal identifies the problem of people lacking motivation to learn about DIDs and getting involved in crypto ecosystems. They will ad value to the Cardano ecosystem by onboarding new people and incentivizing innovation. The metrics are in line with the Challenge in the sense of issuing DIDs to new users. The project is able to scale as it will be open source.
f6_assessments.q1: Only one team member that provided proof of skills via LinkedIn page. Additional members are needed to build this type of project. The budget is for living costs for him and his family for 3 months. More funding will be required in future rounds and more team members will hopefully join. The time to complete this whole project isn't provided, but a whole year has been allocated to complete a certain phase of the project. I think this will become clearer when the necessary team members join. He explains what the core functions will be of this project, but doesn't explain the technical way of how it will be built. No architecture or languages were mentioned. Explaining the technical process of building this will show voters your approach to solving the problem and could potentially boost confidence in your abilities. No challenges or risks have been considered. Not being aware or prepared for risks can slow you down when they surface.
f6_assessments.q2: A roadmap with minimal milestones have been provided. It is not clear exactly what is getting done. Providing  more detailed milestones will show what is getting done and enable the community to track the progress of your project. A few KPIs have been provided, but not very effective ones. More user based KPIs would be beneficial for a project like this. Making it easier to track the performance of the project. They identify the problem of people lacking motivation to learn about DIDs and getting involved in crypto ecosystems and they solve this by creating a platform that uses DIDs to provide basic free income and incentivize innovation and collaboration.

f6_assessments.q0: As the proposer underlined, "This platform is built on 2 principles - Everyone's Time is valuable, and Everyone has a right to use the best-known technology to pursue his dreams." so after the unfunded proposal in Fund 6, the proposer has adjusted the vision and focused on delivery in 3 months project. The proposer has highlighted the importance of PRISM and Cardano to address the decentralisation identity and compare with all the pre-non-purpose services at the initial, such as Wikipedia, and show how they grew today. Good comparisons indeed.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal has requested $5000 for the first three months to deliver the prototype on SOIL - Scalable Open Innovation Ledger – one of the listed "Rough outline of execution". I believe it is deliverable with his current software skill sets
f6_assessments.q2: Despite the three-month workload that has been provided but is still relatively brief, I believe you should show how the public and the challenge team (IOG in this case) monitor your progress easier. This information should be included in your three months work breakdown structure.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea is excellent, taking advantage of Accelerate Decentralized Identity combining e-commerce and intellectual property promises to bring great economic value. The proposal also points out the opportunities and challenges related to Cardano's blockchain platform and suggests how to optimize it. If this project is successful, it will be a big step forward because it affects the economic behavior of users.
f6_assessments.q1: The analysis and plan in the proposal are very convincing. He understands what he says. He also has a good overview of e-commerce, blockchain technology, accelerate decentralized and identy, Cardano system and he has clear vision for this project. He seems very passionate about this project since he's attempt to do it many time from Fund 6 to here. However it would be better if the proposal is more detail about plan, what detail expected outcome in each phase/milestone?
f6_assessments.q2: The project includes lauch dates and success metrics with are useful for auditing the progress and the success of the proposal.
